title: ‘Jack Irish’ DVD offers a flawed, noirish detective
text:
Photo: Acorn Media Image 1 of / 1 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 1 dvd cover "Jack Irish: Set Two" dvd cover "Jack Irish: Set Two" Photo: Acorn Media ‘Jack Irish’ DVD offers a flawed, noirish detective 1  /  1 Back to Gallery 
Jack Irish : Set Two 
In the league of private eye noir, the more flawed and physically messed up our anti-hero is, the better the noir gets as we learn more about what fouls him up. Guy Pearce , who won an Emmy for “Mildred Pierce” in 2011, deserves abundant credit for portraying a onetime defense attorney turned private eye, who in the first season of this Australian-produced series lived through the murder of his wife, Isabel.
Based on a series of novels set in the city of Melbourne by Peter Temple , this second season, fully titled “Jack Irish: Dead Point,” finds our anguished crime fighter confronted by his late wife’s father, a judge who has uncovered criminal activity and wants Irish to track down a red-bound book, the MacGuffin, as Alfred Hitchcock would call it. And that leads Jack into a dark world of gambling, femme fatales, murder and blackmail.
Of course, Jack is still being haunted by the death of his wife, and he renews his previously messed-up love affair with a beautiful blonde — a radio journalist portrayed by Marta Dusseldorp , who has been scoring so well in “A Place to Call Home,” another excellent Australian-made TV series. 
There’s some nice behind-the-scenes bonus footage and subtitles, just in case the Australian accents get a bit heavy. — John Stanley 


JACK IRISH: 
SET TWO 
2014
NOT RATED
ACORN MEDIA
$34.99
